ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: SUKCHAR PANCHAM REPERTORY THEATRE AT A GLANCE Regarding our Name Sukchar is the name of the Calcutta suburb whose life and business form the cornerstone of our theatre. We feel that this is the first thing we need to say about ourselves. Pancham, which is fifth in English, refers primarily to what is often called the fifth veda  the theory of drama by the sage, Bharata. We aim to rediscover the classical and folk roots of Indian theatre. The five fingers on a hand are not all of the same length, but this variety can be a source of strength. Whether we are five or five hundred, here the big and the little come together and work together- the basis of our strength and well-being. This is what Tagore thinks about the number five, as he describes his hero Amit in the novel Shesher Kobita: There is something special in his appearance  he isnt just any one of a group of five, he is rather absolutely the fifth, and attracts the greatest attention, to the detriment of others. Pa, the fifth note of the octave, is almost indispensable in all forms of Indian music. We dream about and work towards a future when any discussion of Indian theatre shall find us a small but indispensable part of its history. Regarding our Work Staging sixty-odd plays in twenty three years ourselves, we also organise Chhotoder Natoker Ekdin Pratidin, -One day theatre in education workshop for students. Over a period of twenty three years, we have worked with students from about hundred institutes ranging from primary schools to graduate colleges to help them to act, put them on stage, enrolled them in drama clubs. The regular Creativity & Personality Development Workshop in schools is named as Srishtisukh. To encourage them further, we have organised inter-school drama competitions, under a programme named Tiner Talowar. Organized Shishutirtha - seven days summer camp for students & Bado Hawa Khub Bhul - an open forum with child-psychologists and guardians for a healthy generation. We have been helping the challenged persons in behavioral therapy through theatre at a home called Anandolok. Besides, weve experience to work in a long phase with the lifers for their rehabilitation at Dum Dum Central Correctional Home. We have brought together rural folk artists and street drama groups in our Folk Culture Festivals. For twenty straight years, we have been putting on the annual Darshaker Darbar, a unique drama festival in Bengali where the director must face the audience after the show and answer their questions. There is even a prize for one who asks the best question. We have prepared and produced plays on topical subjects, for the specific needs of social work organizations ranging from education to environment, health issues to psychology, womens problems to child labor & the same for commercial organizations as well. We have produced a bunch of professional theatre artists, put up a unique stage for theatre-on-demand, put together an essential collection of audio cassettes, compact discs, projector slides, movies, books and magazines, published two well-received and critically acclaimed books, established a forum for the discussion and practice of modern, scientific techniques of theatre. We have carved out a free area for children  Tapoban, to learn about the environment and contemplate about their learning. It offers free-form education for children, and aims to supplement the school curriculum with allied arts. Under the Parichay programme, we look for new talents who show promise in these fields. Our success is evident in the fact that those who represent the teaching and driving force of our group today were once recruited here as trainees.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Sundarika Bartika is a non profit making organisation which was established in 1982 (Registered in 1987 ). Two Bengali word Sundarika & Bartika, Sundarika means omen or auspicious and Bartika means lighted lamp or flame. To eradicate rural derkness as well as problems i.e. Illitaracy, Poverty, Unhealthy, Population, Superstition evils, ets. We have burned the auspicious lamp Sundarika Bartika. Sundarika Bartika is that organisation which was started by a group of individual, today has more than 50 people engage for the cause. They are dedicated and sincere in their effort to serve the people, while a handful are full time, some are part time and others provides their voluntary but valuable support. The works as the initial stage was physical and culture based but today organisation is involved in activiities such as education, environmrnt, agriculture, awareness building, self help group, vocational training, income generation for the benefit of women and children of minority community. This has been possible due to people participation in the programmes. The various departments of Sundarika Bartika are supervised by the department heads (co-ordinator) who in turn responsible to the Secretary. Sundarika Bartika is currently, working in two district of West Bengal,( Diamond Harbour Block-II, Mathurapur Block-II of South 24 Parganas and Baghmundi & Bundwan Block of Purulia District) and it provides two kinds of services: Community Based Rehabilitation and Institutional. The focus of Sundarika Bartikas work has always rural minorities and Tribal area- to fight against all sorts of oppression and set out on a journey with three goals: (1).Human Resource Development (2).Socio-economic Development. (3) Conservation of Natural Resource and Environment. Major Activities of Subdarika Bartika are : 1.Vocational Training Programme Diamond Harbour Block-II ( 8 GP ) Drooped out Girls(15-20 Years) 2.Awareness Campaign on Restriction on use of Plastic Carry Bags Bhadura Haridas, Kalatalaht & Noorpur GP Students, Shop-Keepers 3.Education Programme a) Primary School Kalatalahat GP Children 4-10 Years b) Innovative Education Centre (NFE) Purulia Dist. D/H Block-II, 24 Pgs. Dist Tribal & Migrated Children (4-14 yrs) c)Free Coaching Centre Kalatalahat GP Needy Students, Class:V-VIII 4. LIBRARY, Information Centre 5. Farmers Training on Organic farming Kalatalahat GP, Farmers 6. NEAC Kalatalahat GP, Students , Farmers 7. Care of Environment & Nature Study D/H Block-II Students,10-18 yrs 8. Youth Development Centre 9. Bratachari  Dance & Musical secession (Academy ) 10. Rural Sports Club- Joga, Gym & Sports 11. Health Check up & Blood Donation camp Besides the above activities members of Sundarika Bartika Participated in the following Important Programme/Events 1.Meeting with W. J Clinton ( Former President of USA at Rajbhavan-Kolkata - April-2001 2.Cultex  Gauhati & Tripura June 2003 3.National Students &Youth Parliament -Special Session on HIV/AIDS, New Delhi November 2004 4.Rally on Jung -E Azadi (Meerat to Delhi ) May 2007 5.IPCC convention , Kolkata , October 2007

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Taraknath Maternity and Child Welfare Centre is an independent Non Government Organization which is instrumental in making lives of not only local people living in Tarakeswar Block, but for the district of Hooghly and also more meaningful to the society. The organization was established in 1973 by the inspiration of some promising ideal personalities like Late Dr. Harisadhan Dutta and his eleven stalwarts like Dr. Moni Kr. Chhetri, Dr. S.N. Chowdhury, Dr. Kanai Ch. Pal, Dr. Chandra Sekhar Dhara, Sri Kalidas Mallick, etc. This centre caters service in the area of health, education, nutrition, Sanitation and many socio- economic spheres with care and caution. The on going projects from those thousands of people of un-served and underserved areas are benefited are as follows: (1) ASHA Training Programme- NRHM (Govt. of India & Govt. of W.B.) (2) I.C.D.S. Training Programme for the AWW & AAW Helper ( Govt. of West Bengal ) (3) Reproductive Child Health Programme (Govt. of India & Govt. of W.B.) (4) Total Sanitation Programme ( Govt. of West Bengal) (5) Sponsorship programme (Through Children International- U.S.A.) (6) Water Testing Lavoratory (Govt. Of West Bengal) (7) Immunization Programme (Govt. Of West Bengal) (8) Vivekananda Swasthya Pariseva Prakalpo ( Through Ramkrishna Mission) (9) Dental Care Unit (10) Mahila Mondal Tailoring Unit. It is a matter of pride and passion that the Govt. of India has declared Nirmal Gram Puraskar to Seven Gram Panchayets of Tarakesar Block, working with us under GO- NGO partnership on Total Sanitation Programme. Taraknath Maternity and Child Welfare Centre had been worked in the field of Reproductive Child Health  II for the last eight year as a nodal agency with the assistance of four partners NGO. The entire works are implemented under the guidance of the District Health Officials and also the related Block Health Officials. In this regard, we tired our level best for the upliftment of the RCH indicators e.g. Early registration of Pregnant women, Full antenatal Check up of the Pregnant Women, increasing of Institutional Delivery, Modern family Planning, Prevention of early marriage, Prevention of neonatal mortality, Prevention of maternal mortality etc. and the fact is that almost of all indicators are in better position than before by tiring our efforts. We have just completed in the very last year ASHA Training Programme of Hooghly District under NRHM. We are testing drinking water for the three blocks of HooghlyDistrict i.e. Tarakeswar, Janmgipara, Haripal Block. Taraknath Maternity and Child Welfare Centre is now working as district training centre for 6&7 Module ASHAs Training for the distract of Hooghly, West Bengal. ICDS Training  It is running from 1982, approx 10,000 trainees successfully trained-up from here Immunization - This our self financing programme we have been able to provide Immunizations to 1, 50,000 beneficiaries from the inception day of the Institution
